Raswanth Prasath

Civil Engineering & Transportation Engineering Student

raswanth [AT] asu.edu

Bio

I am a Civil Engineering student at Arizona State University, specializing in transportation engineering with a focus on traffic modeling, geospatial analysis, and data-driven infrastructure solutions. My work involves developing intelligent transportation systems, conducting traffic impact studies, and leveraging machine learning and GIS tools to improve urban mobility and safety.

My professional experience includes designing traffic control systems and pedestrian signals at HR Green, conducting advanced GIS analysis at the School of Earth and Space Exploration, and performing traffic engineering consulting at Concept Dash. I completed my B.Tech. in Civil Engineering at NIT Tiruchirappalli, where I developed expertise in traffic calming measures and road safety at the Centre of Excellence for Road Safety (CoERS), IIT Madras. I am passionate about combining Python, QGIS, traffic simulation tools (VISSIM, Synchro), and machine learning to solve complex transportation challenges and contribute to safer, more efficient urban systems.

News

  • May 2025. Started as a Transportation Intern at HR Green, designing HAWK pedestrian signals and traffic signal models.

  • January 2025. Started as a Graduate Research Assistant at the School of Earth and Space Exploration, ASU, working on GIS-based fault location tools.

  • August 2024. Started my Master of Science in Civil, Environmental & Sustainable Engineering at Arizona State University.

  • July 2024. Completed my role as Traffic and Transportation Engineer at Concept Dash, conducting traffic impact studies and analysis.

  • June 2023. Completed my internship at Centre of Excellence for Road Safety (CoERS), IIT Madras, working on traffic calming measures and road safety analysis.

  • May 2023. Graduated with B.Tech. in Civil Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli.

Posts

Vitæ

  • Tempe, Arizona
    May'25 - Present

    Transportation Intern - HR Green

    Designed concept plans for HAWK pedestrian signal for the City of Buckeye, ensuring regulatory compliance and ADA standards. Created 3D isometric traffic signal models for the City of Glendale with ITS components and conductor schedules.

  • Tempe, Arizona
    Jan'25 - Present

    Graduate Research Assistant - School of Earth and Space Exploration, ASU

    Lead developer of a GIS-based fault location uncertainty plotting tool for the utility industry and academia. Coded fault buffer tools in QGIS and ArcGIS Pro using Python. Implemented geological terminology and 3D structural geology visualization skills.

  • Toronto, Ontario
    Oct'23 - Jul'24

    Traffic and Transportation Engineer - Concept Dash

    Conducted traffic impact studies, transportation demand management, and parking analysis. Utilized Synchro models to analyze traffic patterns and prepared professional reports. Formulated spreadsheets in Excel, interpreted data, and determined traffic patterns.

  • Chennai, India
    Dec'22 - Jun'23

    Project Intern - Centre of Excellence for Road Safety (CoERS), IIT Madras

    Assessed effectiveness of traffic calming measures using spot speed studies. Analyzed 3,000 vehicles to evaluate impact of road humps, speed tables, and transverse bar markings on speeds. Provided insights and recommendations for enhanced road safety.

  • Tempe, Arizona
    Aug'24 - May'26

    M.S. Civil, Environmental & Sustainable Engineering - Arizona State University

    Master of Science program with GPA 3.67/4.00. Coursework: Traffic Modelling and Simulation, Transportation Planning, Deep Learning, Pavement Design, Traffic Flow Theory, Highway Geometric Design, Activity-Travel Behavior Model.

  • Tiruchirappalli, India
    Aug'19 - May'23

    B.Tech. Civil Engineering - National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli

    Bachelor of Technology in Civil Engineering with GPA 3.36/4.00. Comprehensive foundation in civil engineering fundamentals with focus on infrastructure design, analysis, and construction methodologies.

Publications

Other Projects

  • Learning-Based Data Association for Vehicle Trajectories

    Implemented data association of fragmented trajectory data using learning-based models. Utilized logistic regression as a cost function to achieve 89% reduction in trajectory fragmentation. Evaluated tracking performance using CLEAR MOT metrics for vehicle trajectory analysis.

    Tags: #machine-learning #data-association #vehicle-tracking #python

  • Transportation Data Science Project (TDSP)

    Analyzed NYC's Motor Vehicle Collisions dataset to identify trends in accident frequency and geospatial hotspots. Conducted time series analysis to uncover seasonal patterns and geospatial analysis to map high-risk zones across NYC.

    Tags: #data-science #geospatial-analysis #time-series #python #gis
